article_node.title: US Joins Global Bond Rout, China Military Showcase, Poland’s Paralysis
article_node.summary: US Treasury yields spiked as long‑maturity European debt fell, pushing the 30‑year yield toward 5%. UK long bonds hit a 1998 high, dragging the pound lower amid budget concerns. The Treasury Secretary announced plans to interview candidates for the Fed Chair role. China’s Xi showcased military strength at a parade, while Google faced antitrust scrutiny over data sharing. Meanwhile, Poland’s political paralysis threatens NATO’s defense posture in Europe.
